title: Police officer, suspect shot in Roxbury during chase
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A Boston police officer and suspect were shot during a foot chase in Roxbury early Friday morning.
The officer was shot in the arm, while the suspect was hit multiple times in the legs; both are hospitalized.
A high-capacity firearm was recovered; Mayor Wu expressed gratitude for responders and concerns over gun violence.

title: The last person to question Charlie Kirk
author: Jack Healy and Reid J. Epstein, The New York Times
bullets: Charlie Kirk was assassinated during a rally at Utah Valley University on September 10, 2025.
Hunter Kozak, a liberal TikToker, was the last to speak with Kirk, questioning him on mass shootings.
The gunman is still at large, prompting Kozak to worry about his and his family's safety post-event.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague back in jail just days after release
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: North Andover Officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons was ordered back to jail after failing to comply with alcohol testing conditions.
Fitzsimmons was shot by a colleague during an incident involving a restraining order filed by her fiancé.
Judge ruled her non-compliance with alcohol testing conditions posed a public safety risk, prompting return to jail.

title: The owners of the orange dinosaur are suing Saugus. Here’s why.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: TB Holdings LLC is suing Saugus, alleging town officials delayed their Essex Landing development and pressured for a $200,000 payment.
The lawsuit claims Town Manager Scott Crabtree demanded a $200,000 'grant' to Saugus parks to advance the project approval.
Despite ongoing litigation, TB Holdings plans to proceed with the Essex Landing development, including condos and an assisted living facility.

title: Heidi Watney happily returns to Fenway with Apple TV+ for Yankees-Red Sox: ‘It’s like coming home’
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Heidi Watney returns to Fenway Park with Apple TV+ for Yankees-Red Sox game coverage.
Watney was part of NESN's Red Sox coverage from 2008-2011 before joining MLB Network.
She values the balance between career and family, enjoying Apple TV+ role with her sons.

title: Brian Walshe reportedly stabbed in jail while awaiting murder trial
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Brian Walshe was stabbed at Norfolk County Correctional Center while awaiting trial for allegedly murdering his wife Ana in 2023.
The assault occurred Thursday night; Walshe was treated at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and returned to jail.
The Norfolk County Sheriff's Office confirmed a makeshift weapon was used and an investigation into the incident is ongoing.

title: Former Patriots players share drastic measures Bill Belichick would take for team’s trips to Miami
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have struggled against Dolphins in Miami, losing last five games, including under Bill Belichick.
Belichick employed varied travel strategies, like arriving five days early and staying at different hotels, to improve Miami performance.
Former players Hoyer and Andrews couldn't pinpoint a reason for losses, noting challenges of Miami's environment.

title: Amid former Celtic Terry Rozier’s gambling investigation, Hornets cancel ‘Sports Betting’ theme night
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Terry Rozier, Miami Heat guard, is under investigation for irregular betting patterns during his time with the Hornets.
The Charlotte Hornets canceled 'Sports Betting Night' against the Heat, following Rozier's ongoing gambling investigation.
Rozier played only 10 minutes in a 2023 game where suspicious bets totaling $14,000 were placed on his performance.

title: Former Boston Children’s Hospital doctor pleads guilty to child porn charges
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Christopher Sheerer, 37, a former Boston Children's Hospital fellow, pleaded guilty to federal child pornography charges.
Sheerer was charged with distribution, possession, and sexual exploitation of children; sentencing is scheduled for December 18.
Authorities found abusive images and chats on Sheerer's devices during a search at his Boston residence in July 2024.

title: Wu responds to Kraft’s decision to drop out of mayoral race
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu thanked Josh Kraft after he dropped out of the Boston mayoral race.
Kraft decided to donate $3 million to local charities instead of continuing his campaign.
Kraft's withdrawal may allow the next-highest vote-getter, Domingos DaRosa, onto the ballot.
